description: {"blocks":[{"key":"be00n","text":"This protocol is used for successful NGS library preparation from total RNA of animal tissue samples. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a10h1","text":"With this method we obtained full-length paramyxovirus genomes using the Illumina sequencing platform. It works most efficiently on RNA viruses possessing a polyA tail, but it can also be used for sequencing any other RNA viral sequences originating from tissue samples. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

fork_info.title: NGS library preparation using Ovation RNA-Seq System V2 (M01206v9) and Ovation Ultralow System V2 (M01437 v2) for animal tissue samples

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"7t1je","text":"Thaw components used in each step and immediately place them on ice. Always keep thawed reagents and reaction tubes on ice unless otherwise instructed. Do not thaw all reagents at once. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"504me","text":"After thawing and mixing buffer mixes, if any precipitate is observed, re-dissolve the precipitate completely prior to use. You may gently warm the buffer mix for 2 minutes at room temperature followed by brief vortexing. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cuda9","text":"Keep enzyme mixes on ice after briefly spinning to collect the contents. Do not vortex enzyme mixes nor warm any enzyme or primer mixes.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"87mlv","text":"When instructed to mix via pipetting, gently aspirate and dispense a volume that is at least half of the total volume of the reaction mix.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cirrn","text":"Use only fresh ethanol stocks to prepare the dilutions of ethanol washes throughout the purification protocols.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4k8eq","text":"Return all reagents to their appropriate storage conditions promptly after use unless otherwise instructed.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ostf","text":"Total RNA input must be between 500 pg and 100 ng.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dvu9u","text":"RNA samples must be free of contaminating proteins and other cellular material, organic solvents (including phenol and ethanol) and salts used in many RNA isolation methods.
